text:
Hey together,

i made one popup form and set it one page and when i open the page then it’s showing fine but after close it it not appear again, already test it to incognito
a little late to the party, but here's one i recently built out with hubdb and isotope for the filtering: <https://www.marconet.com/resources>
So.  Who has a good solution for an infinite scrolling blog?

I'm trying to get a better understanding of how (and when) HubSpot CMS is a good fit for building an ecommerce site. I've built a number of HubSpot CMS sites but they've all been lead gen focused. Is it as straightforward as building templates per usual and installing 3rd integrations to handle typical ecommerce functionality like inventory tracking, payments etc? Or perhaps this is trying to fit a square peg in a round hole and it's better to build the site (or at least the store) on a Magento or Shopify. And is there a world where the ecommerce site would have the store is built on a Shopify type site and the marketing pages built on HubSpot CMS? Just trying to understand from a architectural high level where and when HubSpot CMS is a good for building ecommerce sites, thank you!
I think the only way to do it is via blog api. Use some sort of scroll/resize event listener and query away
it does not handle payment processing. Use it for the main site/landing pages. I have used shopify’s buy button sdk with the main site on HubSpot
That setup; however, depends on how simple/complex your products are
There are some folks in <#CGM4KH8KG|ecommerce-bridge> that could help you out further
:raising_hand: Roll call! Who else is here?
trying to figure out how to load in multiple pages of results returned from the API request
